body.p: This day has been utterly wasted. Beyond a few letters & a visit to Marsden in the afternoon, nothing has been done.

p.hi: I saddened myself before going to bed by turning over a drawer–full of letters. The writers were mostly dead. My Father, Jennie, Campion, Cockayne – all dead: & I linger on, &, as the world counts, am a successful man: but my heart is empty, or rather it is for ever hungry.
What balderdash this talk of 'success' is!

The "Daily News" had a very hostile & unjust leader on my lecture at the Working Men's Institute. It refers to me as if I were the type of carpet–cleric, whom I most despise. I was angry at first, but not for long. What
they know about me, these minions of convention?
Henceforward, for good or evil, I will live my own life in the sight of God
